attributes.comment:
It is astounding to me that you could possibly be even considering raising the fees
charged for your ?SERVICES?. The current fee of $545 dollars to process an I-
600A is ridiculous. The ?service? we have received has been the most unhelpful of
any agency that I have EVER dealt with. I wouldn?t pay $5 for it. We are going on
5 months now waiting for our paperwork to be processed. More than once we have
been requested to submit information in a case study that was already there.

Why don?t you use the money that is currently being generated to invest in some
computers and competent employees? Every time we get a form letter from the
CIS, it is filled with typos and errors. They also don?t offer any help or suggestions
to remedy their perceived problem; no contact information of any kind, outside of
snail mail. No phone numbers, no email addresses, no web sites, nothing. I get
the idea that these people don?t want to be bothered with helping anyone. Are
these the people in charge of protecting me and my family in the United States?
Maybe instead of worrying about raising rates, you should worry about raising the
QUALITY of service given to those who are already paying an outrageous amount
for it, and not getting it.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
